formattedAddress: 155 E 48th St, New York, NY 10017, USA
adrFormatAddress: 155 E 48th St, New York, NY 10017, USA

originalText.text: Come for the sushi...Stay for the wisdom.  I love that every Kabbalah one class starts with a gathering for people to get to know each other.  I have studied many paths but I have never before  found true lovers of humanity.  They dont just teach you here, they show you how to be a better, more successful, more connected  human being.  And the Sushi is great too....

originalText.text: It is my pleasure to write a review for the wonderful Kabbalah Center. The center offers insightful courses and wisdom led by a truly wonderful team and leaders. The courses are designed and delivered to help with every aspect of life from business to relationships, taught via the wisdom of the Kabbalah. The center foundation is spirituality and humanity and welcomes everyone who is interested in elevating themselves and helping make a positive difference in our personal and business lives and making a powerful positive impact on the world.

text.text: It is my pleasure to write a review for the wonderful Kabbalah Center. The center offers insightful courses and wisdom led by a truly wonderful team and leaders. The courses are designed and delivered to help with every aspect of life from business to relationships, taught via the wisdom of the Kabbalah. The center foundation is spirituality and humanity and welcomes everyone who is interested in elevating themselves and helping make a positive difference in our personal and business lives and making a powerful positive impact on the world.

originalText.text: The study of Kabbalah will change the way you look at life.  You will find life's journey a little easier through the study of the teachings. You have an option of studying online or for a deeper connection you can come to Centre. Keep an open mind and heart and open the door to a new eye-opening reality. The tools you will receive will definitely reveal the concealed secrets of this journey called life.

originalText.text: An amazing place and people with the energy teaching us about life's tools for  happiness, prosperity, manifesting our desires and cleansing our tikkune.  I am learning to be the best version of myself! What a gift!

text.text: An amazing place and people with the energy teaching us about life's tools for  happiness, prosperity, manifesting our desires and cleansing our tikkune.  I am learning to be the best version of myself! What a gift!

originalText.text: I had joined the kabbalah center in the late 1980's. I was a member until 2000. My husband and I loved the Rav and Karen and the teachers and staff. All were helpful and kind as we were coming back to our roots. We stopped going to the center as we moved and it was too far away to walk to the services. After my husband passed away I moved to Pennsylvania and rejoined the center. I did some on-line Shabbats. I also did Rosh Hashanah and Yom Kippur. I was not satisfied as with both holidays as I got cut off before it was over and I couldn't get it back. I missed the shofar blowing. I also called for pinchas water and I was told he was to busy and I should call back on Wednesday (I called Monday). I didn't call back.  I also called about the RH, YK cut off and the response I got was they were sorry, but they didn't know how it happened. I feel bad because I see that the services are not  the same. The feeling of love is missing. I'm sorry my review isn't good.
